name: Single Arm Plank to Row
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart on the ground and your body forming a straight line from your head to your heels.
2. Lift one arm off the ground, keeping it straight, and engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine.
3. Hold the plank position for 5-10 seconds.
4. Now transition into a single-arm row, moving your lifted hand toward the opposite shoulder as you do so.
You can keep your other arm extended on the ground, or place it on your hip if needed for stability.
5. Return to the starting plank position and repeat with the opposite arm.
short_summary: The Single Arm Plank to Row exercise targets the back muscles in a plyometric motion.
